docs.lead_paragraph: Oregon coach Dana Altman figures it could be decades before his players truly appreciate what it means to win consecutive Pac-12 championships.

headline.print_headline: No. 6 Oregon Downs Oregon State 80-59, Wins Share of Pac-12

docs.lead_paragraph: Japan's ruling party approved a change in party rules Sunday that could pave the way for Prime Minister Shinzo Abe to become the country's longest-serving leader in the post-World War II era.

headline.print_headline: Rule Change Could Make Abe Longest-Serving Leader in Japan
headline.main: Rule Change Could Make Abe Longest-Serving Leader in Japan

docs.snippet: Japan's ruling party approved a change in party rules Sunday that could pave the way for Prime Minister Shinzo Abe to become the country's longest-serving leader in the post-World War II era....

docs.lead_paragraph: Vice President Mike Pence is criticizing The Associated Press for listing his wife's email address in a story about his frequent resistance to public records requests while Indiana's governor.

headline.print_headline: Pence Criticizes AP for Publishing His Wife's Email Address
headline.main: Pence Criticizes AP for Publishing His Wife's Email Address

docs.snippet: Vice President Mike Pence is criticizing The Associated Press for listing his wife's email address in a story about his frequent resistance to public records requests while Indiana's governor....

docs.lead_paragraph: Patience will be a virtue for Rory McIlroy on Sunday as he seeks to win the WGC-Mexico Championship and possibly regain the world number one ranking.

docs.lead_paragraph: China's top economic official trimmed its growth target and warned Sunday of dangers from global pressure for trade controls, as Beijing tries to build a consumer-driven economy and reduce reliance on exports and investment.

headline.print_headline: China Trims 2017 Growth Target, Warns Against Trade Controls
headline.main: China Trims 2017 Growth Target, Warns Against Trade Controls

docs.snippet: China's top economic official trimmed its growth target and warned Sunday of dangers from global pressure for trade controls, as Beijing tries to build a consumer-driven economy and reduce reliance on exports and investment....

docs.lead_paragraph: While Jill Ellis never wants to see the United States women's soccer team lose a game, the coach believes good things can come out of a setback, especially in an event without a major prize.

headline.main: England Stuns US Women 1-0 in SheBelieves Cup Soccer

docs.lead_paragraph: China will encourage foreign-invested firms to list and issue bonds in the country, state news agency Xinhua reported on Sunday, citing a government work report.

headline.print_headline: China to Encourage Foreign-Invested Firms to List, Issue Bonds: Xinhua
headline.main: China to Encourage Foreign-Invested Firms to List, Issue Bonds: Xinhua

docs.snippet: China will encourage foreign-invested firms to list and issue bonds in the country, state news agency Xinhua reported on Sunday, citing a government work report....

docs.lead_paragraph: China will cut steel capacity by 50 million tonnes and coal output by more than 150 million tonnes this year, its top economic planner said on Sunday as the world's No. 2 economy deepens efforts to tackle pollution and curb excess supply.

headline.print_headline: China Vows New Steel, Coal Capacity Cuts to Make Sky Blue
headline.main: China Vows New Steel, Coal Capacity Cuts to Make Sky Blue

docs.snippet: China will cut steel capacity by 50 million tonnes and coal output by more than 150 million tonnes this year, its top economic planner said on Sunday as the world's No. 2 economy deepens efforts to tackle pollution and curb excess supply....
